## This research: Retributive Public Justice

::: {.incremental .highlight-last style="font-size: 100%;"}

- Preferences and perceptions about inequality and redistribution [@mccall_undeserving_2013; @kelley_legitimation_1993]

- Distributive justice [@cavaille_fair_2023; @osberg_fair_2006a]

- Theory of equity [@adams_inequity_1965]

- Differences between what I contribute to society and what I receive

- Are the public goods I get considered just according to my (perceived) contributions?

:::

## Research question {.black data-background-color="#5f5758"}

::: { .slarge}

How do individual beliefs about inequality shape perceptions of retributive public justice across OECD countries, and to what extent are these perceptions conditioned by individual and country-level characteristics?

:::

## Individual factors

::: {.incremental .highlight-last style="font-size: 100%;"}

- Meritocracy is fundamental to determining how individuals evaluate justice of social and economic outcomes [@sandel_tyranny_2020; @batruch_belief_2023]

- Individuals attributing poverty to lack of effort or ambition tend to support more restrictive welfare policies and perceive benefict recipients as undeserving [@petersen_deservingness_2011; @vanoorschot_making_2006]

- People who perceive more inequality are more likely to perceive that they receive fewer rewards from society [@mijs_paradox_2021b; @easterbrook_social_2021]


:::

## Contextual factors

::: {.incremental .highlight-last style="font-size: 100%;"}

- Gini index; GDP per-capita

- Relative poverty

- Country welfare-state (i.e. Conservative, social-democratic, southern...)

- Tax revenue (% of GDP);  Progressivity of personal income tax


:::


## Data and methods

- [Risks that matter survey 2022](https://www.oecd.org/en/data/datasets/risks-that-matter-data-and-methodology.html)

- Cross-national survey assesses perceptions of social and economic risks and related policy preferences

- Conducted in 25 OECD countries (Austria, Belgium, Canada, **Chile**, Denmark, Finalnd, France, Germany, **Ireland**...)

- Multilevel analysis

- Central dependent variable: Redistributive public justice:

*"I feel that I receive a fair share of public benefits, given the taxes and social contributions I pay and/or have paid in the past"*
